case_vignette:
An elderly man presents with asymptomatic hyperpigmented, confluent, brown macules on his upper and lower lips, along with hyperpigmented macules on his hands. He also has diffuse blue-black bilateral melanonychia with nail dystrophy on his toenails, and his fingernails contain longitudinal melanonychia with hyperpigmentation of the proximal nail beds. He denies any family history of mucocutaneous pigmentation or gastrointestinal or systemic symptoms. In the last 5 years, results of a colonoscopy, upper gastrointestinal endoscopy, and blood work have all been within normal limits. The patient has a history of smoking and has been a heavy drinker in the past. He has a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia, but his current medications are not listed. The patient's physical examination is notable for the presence of a 1.5 cm x 1.5 cm brown macule on his upper lip, a 1.5 cm x 1.5 cm brown macule on his lower lip, and multiple brown macules on his hands. The patient's nails are also notable for the presence of diffuse blue-black melanonychia with nail dystrophy on his toenails and longitudinal melanonychia with hyperpigmentation of the proximal nail beds on his fingernails. The patient's skin and nail findings are consistent with a diagnosis of Peutz-Jeghers syndrome, but the patient's lack of gastrointestinal symptoms and family history makes this diagnosis less likely. The patient's history of smoking and heavy drinking in the past, along with his current hypertension and hyperlipidemia, may be contributing factors to his skin and nail findings.

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I have brown spots on my upper and lower lips, as well as on my hands. I also have blue-black discolored nails with some nail distortion on my toenails, and my fingernails have similar discoloration along with darkening near the base of the nails.
Have you experienced any recent trauma or injury to your nails or skin?
No, I have not experienced any recent trauma or injury to my nails or skin.
Do you have any known chronic illnesses or are you currently on any medication?
I have a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia, but I am not currently listing any medications.
Have these spots and nail changes appeared suddenly or gradually over time?
The spots and nail changes have appeared gradually over time.
Do you have any family history of skin or nail disorders?
No, I do not have any family history of skin or nail disorders.
Final Diagnosis: Laugier-Hunziker syndrome
